tgs_version.description: The version of TGS being used

json_generation.description: The date the JSON was generated

csv_last_modified.description: The date the CSV data was last modified

name.description: The full official name of the Profile as used in their branding and documentation.

profileTypeId.description: The primary operational category or business model of the Profile (e.g. DAO, project, investor, government). Refer to standardized list of Profile types.

profileSectorId.description: The primary industry, use case, or problem space the Profile operates in or serves. Refer to standardized list of sectors and subsectors.

profileStatusId.description: The current operational state of the Profile (e.g. Active, Inactive, Closed). Refer to the standardized list of status options.

foundingDate.description: The date when the Profile was first established, registered, or publicly announced. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD) when possible. Can usually be shortened to Month and Year.

logo.description: Provide a full rectangle logo (wordmark + icon) that works on a white background and be transparent. Preferably an SVG image file. If it is a PNG, it should have a minimum resolution of 256px height.

icon.description: Provide a square profile icon that works on a white background and be transparent. Preferably an SVG image file. If it is a PNG, it should have a minimum resolution of 256px height.

descriptionShort.description: Provide an objective overview of the Profile's primary purpose, product, or service. Avoid subjective claims, marketing language, or unnecessary technical jargon. Focus on clear, factual information. Limit to 200 characters.

descriptionLong.description: A more detailed overview of the Profile, including its mission, target audience, and key features or offerings. Limit to 500 characters and avoid subjective claims.

descriptionMarketing.description: A promotional description aiming to attract and engage potential users or customers. This field allows persuasive language and value driven messaging that highlights the Profile's unique selling points and market advantages. Content should be engaging while remaining factually accurate.

tagLine.description: A brief, memorable phrase or slogan used by the Profile to convey its mission or value proposition. If the tagline is in all caps or contains irregular spaces or line breaks, reformat it to a single line, single spaced, and sentence case.

name.description: The name of a tag which is a reference to something. This something is defined by its description and type.

tagTypeId.description: A reference to a connected table that contains a type. A type of tag provides some context as to what a tag is and also contains a description.

description.description: A description of this tag which provides a short explanation over what this unique tag is about

isArchived.description: A boolean that indicates if a tag is archived.

name.description: Name of the business/operation sector

definition.description: Description of what this sector encompasses

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: Name of the profile status

definition.description: Description of what this status means for a profile

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: Name of the profile type

definition.description: Description of what this type of profile represents

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: Name of the tag category

definition.description: Description of what this type of tag represents

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: The official name of the Asset as used in its branding, marketing, and trading materials.

ticker.description: The unique trading symbol used to represent the Asset on exchanges and trading platforms. Use only capital letters and numbers.

icon.description: A square PNG but ideally an SVG image file representing the Asset's icon or logo, with a transparent background and a minimum resolution of 128x128 pixels.

description.description: A concise, one-sentence summary of the Asset's key characteristics, use case, or value proposition. Limit to 200 characters and avoid subjective claims.

assetTypeId.description: The primary category or function of the Asset (e.g. Currency, Utility, Security) and what is does.

address.description: The unique smart contract address of the Asset on the blockchain it is deployed on. Use a standard blockchain explorer to validate the address.

rootId.description: A reference to the Profile associated with the Asset, using the Profile's unique identifier or name.

assetStatusId.description: The current development or access stage of the asset. Refer to the standardized list of asset status options.

name.description: The name of the status (e.g. Active or Deprecated)

definition.description: Description of what this status means for an asset

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: Name of the asset category

definition.description: Description of what this type of asset represents

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: The official name of the product as used in its branding, marketing, and user-facing materials.

productTypeId.description: The primary category or function of the product (e.g. exchange, wallet, lending platform). Refer to standardized list of product types.

description.description: A concise, objective statement explaining what the product does and who it is for.

productStatusId.description: The current development or access stage of the product (e.g. Beta, Live, Deprecated).

isMainProduct.description: A boolean value indicating whether the product is the Profile's primary or flagship offering.

launchDate.description: The date when the product was first launched or made publicly available. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD) when possible.

supportsProducts.description: Lists all the products that this product explicitly supports. This also describes a direction of support, for example a wallet may support a chain, but a chain does not support a wallet. Not used for on-chain deployments.

name.description: Name of the product category

definition.description: Description of what this product type encompasses

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: Name of the product status

definition.description: Description of what this status means for a product

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: The legal name of the Entity as registered with the relevant regulatory bodies or government agencies.

tradeName.description: Any additional trading names, brands, or trademarks associated with the Entity, separate from its legal name.

entityTypeId.description: The legal structure or registration category of the Entity (e.g. LLC, Foundation, Corporation).

dateOfIncorporation.description: The date when the Entity was legally registered or incorporated. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD) when possible.

localRegistrationNumber.description: The registration number assigned to the Entity by the relevant regulatory body or government agency, if applicable.

taxIdentificationNumber.description: The unique tax identification number assigned to the Entity by the relevant tax authority, if applicable.

address.description: The registered physical address of the Entity, including street, city, state/province (if applicable), and postal code.

countryId.description: The country in which the Entity is legally registered or incorporated, using the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code format.

leiNumber.description: The Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) code assigned to the Entity by the Global Legal Entity Identifier Foundation (GLEIF), if applicable.

name.description: Name of the entity structure type

definition.description: Description of what this type of entity structure represents

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: Official name of the country

code.description: The short hand code for the country

socialTypeId.description: The specific social media platform the URL belongs to (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, Discord). Refer to the standardized list of social media platforms

socialStatusId.description: The current operational state of the social. Refer to the standardized list of status options.

name.description: The handle associated with the Profile's social media account on the specified platform. This should match the handle displayed on the social media profile page and is often at the end of the URL.
Name of the social media platform

definition.description: Description of the social media platform type

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

deploymentTypeId.description: Categorizes the type of deployment based on the smart contract’s main purpose. For example, if the contract is primarily used to mint an asset, it will be tagged as ‘mint’.

deployedOnId.description: Specifies which blockchain a smart contract is deployed on. If a product or asset does not have a smart contract, meaning it is not deployed on any blockchain, leave this field blank.

assetStandardId.description: The technical standard or protocol specification that the smart contract implements. If the standard cannot be identified, leave this field blank.

deploymentId.description: The Deployment ID links individual smart contracts to their parent deployment record. A deployment can contain multiple related smart contracts (like a protocol's core contracts), but each blockchain deployment must have its own unique deployment record.

name.description: The official identifier or label for the smart contract as used in project documentation and blockchain explorers. If no name is given, leave it blank.

address.description: The unique blockchain address where the smart contract is deployed. Format must match the relevant blockchain's address structure.

deploymentDate.description: The date when the smart contract was deployed to the blockchain. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD). Note: This will be automated in the future.

name.description: The name of the technical standard (e.g. ERC20 or SPL)

definition.description: Detailed description of the standard's purpose and characteristics

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

name.description: Name of the deployment type

definition.description: Description of what this deployment type represents

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

urlTypeId.description: Categorizes the purpose and content of a URL based on its table group in the TGS. The URL type must align with both the content it links to and the context of its parameter group (Profile/Product/Asset/Entity/Social).

url.description: This is a URL that links to different types, it must always start with a "http://" or "https://".

name.description: Name of the URL category

definition.description: Description of what this type of URL represents

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

A URL-friendly version of the Profile's name, used for creating unique, readable URLs and internal references. The slug is automatically generated from the Profile's name, consisting of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

urlMain.description: The main URL of the profile.

firstPublicValidation.description: The date of the profile earliest public validation. This indicates when the profile was first publicly validated.

lastPublicValidation.description: The date of the profile most recent public validation. This indicates when the profile was last publicly validated.

childRootId.description: The child in the relationship, meaning that this is the root that sits underneath the parent.

parentRootId.description: The parent in the root relationship, often this profile acts as the over arching brand to other roots.

relationshipTypeId.description: What is the type of relationship, links to the type table.

name.description: The short hand name which defines the type of the relationship between the parent and the child profiles.

slug.description: The slug of the name, so it can be used in URLs and other places.

productId.description: A product entry that maintains a defined relationship with one or more assets through integration, display, or functional requirements.

assetId.description: An asset entry that functions within a specific product through integration, serving purposes defined by its Asset Type parameter.

assetSupportTypeId.description: A classification of the functional relationship between a product and an asset, indicating how the asset is utilized within the product's operations.

name.description: Name of the support relationship type

definition.description: Description of how this type of support functions between assets

slug.description: Slug, should not contain any spaces and be the same, if not very similar that the name

rootId.description: A link to the root profile that this image is associated with

mediaTypeId.description: Link to the image type classification (e.g., logo, icon, header, screenshot).

url.description: The image file or URL path to the stored image

name.description: The short hand name which defines the type of the image.

slug.description: The slug of the name, so it can be used in URLs and other places.

definition.description: The definition of the image type

countries.description: The country in which the Entity is legally registered or incorporated, using the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code format.

Macedonia, the Former Yugoslav Republic of
Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

socialTypes.description: The specific social media platform the URL belongs to (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, Discord). Refer to the standardized list of social media platforms

oneOf.description: not_set

oneOf.description: Twitter social networking service

oneOf.title: Reddit
oneOf.description: Reddit discussion forum (subreddit)

oneOf.title: Instagram

oneOf.description: YouTube video channel

oneOf.title: Discord
oneOf.description: Link to Discord chat service, looks something like https://discord.gg/%handler%

oneOf.title: Farcaster
oneOf.description: Farcaster social networking service

oneOf.title: Facebook
oneOf.description: Facebook social networking service

oneOf.title: TikTok
oneOf.description: TikTok account

oneOf.title: LinkedIn
oneOf.description: LinkedIn professional networking service

oneOf.title: Telegram
oneOf.description: Telegram messaging link (like https://t.me/...)

oneOf.title: GitHub
oneOf.description: GitHub profile

oneOf.title: GitLab
oneOf.description: GitLab profile

oneOf.title: Bluesky
oneOf.description: Bluesky open network profile

oneOf.title: Mastodon
oneOf.description: Mastodon Profile link

oneOf.title: Threads
oneOf.description: Threads social networking service

oneOf.title: Twitch
oneOf.description: Twitch video streaming channel

profileTypes.description: The primary operational category or business model of the Profile (e.g. DAO, project, investor, government). Refer to standardized list of Profile types.

oneOf.description: not_set

oneOf.title: DAO
oneOf.description: A group of individuals with a flattened hierarchy for decision-making and operational execution using blockchain technology.

oneOf.title: Project
oneOf.description: An independent organization or initiative that may have defined or evolving objectives, though not explicitly structured as a formal business entity or governance system.

oneOf.title: Investor
oneOf.description: A profile primarily focused on raising and deploying funds to generate returns on the initial investment.

oneOf.title: Government
oneOf.description: An organization or agency exercising political authority in the interests of its residents or constituents.

oneOf.title: Company
oneOf.description: A profile with a for-profit mandate or a business plan aimed at generating revenue.

oneOf.title: NFT Collection
oneOf.description: A set of unique digital art items, typically created by a single creator or themed to include works from multiple creators.

profileSectors.description: The primary industry, use case, or problem space the Profile operates in or serves. Refer to standardized list of sectors and subsectors.

oneOf.description: not_set

oneOf.title: Finance
oneOf.description: The sector encompassing activities related to the trading or exchanging of fungible assets, such as cryptocurrencies, tokens, or other digital assets, within the blockchain and Web3 ecosystem.

oneOf.title: Developer Tooling
oneOf.description: The sector comprising services, products, and frameworks that support developers in designing, building, and deploying dApps and smart contracts on blockchain platforms.

oneOf.title: Gaming
oneOf.description: The sector that encompasses dApps and platforms that offer interactive entertainment experiences, often integrating blockchain technology for asset ownership, rewards, and in-game economies.

oneOf.title: Infrastructure
oneOf.description: The sector comprising foundational technologies, protocols, and services that enable the operation and interoperability of blockchain networks and dApps. Examples include nodes, staking mechanisms, and cross-chain solutions.

oneOf.title: Blockchain Platforms
oneOf.description: The sector consisting of decentralized platforms and frameworks that allow developers to build, deploy, and interact with smart contracts and dApps. Examples include Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, and Solana.

oneOf.title: Payments
oneOf.description: The sector involving services or platforms that facilitate the transfer of cryptocurrencies or other digital assets from one person or entity to another, often in exchange for goods or services within the decentralized economy.

oneOf.title: Supply chain
oneOf.description: The sector that leverages blockchain technology to enhance the transparency, traceability, and efficiency of the movement of physical goods, including fast-moving consumer goods, across decentralized supply chain networks.

oneOf.title: Data & Analytics
oneOf.description: The sector encompassing services, APIs, and platforms that provide reliable and tamper-proof data, statistics, and insights for the blockchain and Web3 ecosystem. This includes oracles and data providers that feed off-chain information to smart contracts.

oneOf.title: NFTs
oneOf.description: The sector revolving around NFTs, which are unique digital assets stored on a blockchain. This includes NFT marketplaces, creation tools, and platforms that facilitate the minting, trading, and collection of these unique digital items.

oneOf.title: Healthcare
oneOf.description: The sector exploring the application of blockchain technology and decentralized solutions to improve the security, privacy, and interoperability of healthcare data and services, enabling patient-centric approaches and secure data sharing.

oneOf.title: Science
oneOf.description: The sector focused on leveraging blockchain technology and decentralized networks to advance scientific research, collaboration, and funding. This includes projects that aim to democratize access to scientific data, tools, and resources.

oneOf.title: Security
oneOf.description: The sector dedicated to enhancing the safety and resilience of blockchain networks, smart contracts, and dApps through advanced cryptographic techniques, and best practices.

oneOf.title: Mining
oneOf.description: The sector involved in the process of validating transactions and adding new blocks to a blockchain network, typically through PoW consensus mechanisms. This includes mining hardware, software, and pool services.

oneOf.title: Metaverse
oneOf.description: The sector at the intersection of blockchain technology and immersive virtual worlds, where users can interact with digital assets, participate in decentralized economies, and experience new forms of social engagement and creativity.

oneOf.title: Venture Capital
oneOf.description: The sector focused on investing in and supporting the growth of promising blockchain and Web3 projects, startups, and ecosystems through strategic funding, mentorship, and partnerships.

oneOf.title: Community & Events
oneOf.description: The sector that acts as a catch all around groups of people or gatherings that are focused on Web3 & Blockchain but may not have a specific technical product.

oneOf.title: Service Provider
oneOf.description: Offers specialized services to the the Web3 ecosystem which are not covered by the other sectors. These include technical (development, infrastructure), business (marketing, PR, design), financial (accounting, tax), education (training and certifications) legal, consulting, and administrative services.

oneOf.title: Insurance
oneOf.description: The sector dealing with smart contracts or dApps that provide protection for digital assets, on-chain activities, and blockchain-based investments.

oneOf.title: Media
oneOf.description: Includes news websites, image sites and video hosting websites.

oneOf.title: Meme
oneOf.description: The sector that contains all things meme related.

oneOf.title: Social
oneOf.description: Anything to do with social media, social interactions

oneOf.title: Asset Management
oneOf.description: The sector that includes tools, products, or services that allow users to securely store, manage, and interact with their digital assets, such as cryptocurrencies and tokens, within the blockchain ecosystem. Examples include wallets and portfolio management.

oneOf.title: Privacy & Confidentiality
oneOf.description: The sector focused on enhancing user privacy, confidentiality, and data sovereignty within blockchain ecosystems. Profiles in this sector develop or deploy privacy-preserving technologies such as zero-knowledge proofs, homomorphic encryption, secure multi-party computation, or cryptographic techniques that enable verifiable but private transactions and interactions.

profileStatuses.description: The current operational state of the Profile (e.g. Active, Inactive, Closed). Refer to the standardized list of status options.

oneOf.description: not_set

oneOf.title: Announced
oneOf.description: The profile's information is public, but with limited one-way interaction (e.g., newsletter subscription, social media following), or all product(s)/service(s) are not yet available.

oneOf.title: Active
oneOf.description: The profile's offering allows for successful two-way interaction (e.g., using the product/service, building on the blockchain), or the profile maintains a functioning product.

oneOf.title: Inactive
oneOf.description: Interactions with the profile's service/product are frequently unsuccessful, or the service/product is no longer supported or actively developed. Socials have not been active for more than 3 months, invalid or suspended with no other way to contact or follow the project (no blog or up-to-date documentation), even when interaction with the product is still possible.

oneOf.title: Acquired
oneOf.description: The profile has been purchased by or merged with another company/protocol.

oneOf.title: Closed
oneOf.description: Interaction with the profile's offering is no longer possible, or the entity has announced the profile's closure.

productTypes.description: The primary category or function of the product (e.g. exchange, wallet, lending platform). Refer to standardized list of product types.

oneOf.description: not_set

oneOf.title: Launch Pad
oneOf.description: A platform that facilitates the initial offering and distribution of new cryptocurrency tokens, often providing a streamlined process for projects to raise funds and for investors to participate in early-stage token sales.

oneOf.title: Yield Aggregator
oneOf.description: A tool to the process of deploying assets and collecting the rewards on behalf of users.

oneOf.title: Compute Network
oneOf.description: A product that provides decentralized computational resources for specific tasks, such as AI training, graphical rendering, or confidential computing.

oneOf.title: L1
oneOf.description: A base layer blockchain that acts as the lowest settlement layer. Examples include Bitcoin or Ethereum.

oneOf.title: L2
oneOf.description: A blockchain that inherits security from another L1 blockchain, often with the intent to improve either scaling, speed or cost.

oneOf.title: Gambling/Casino
oneOf.description: A blockchain-based platform that offers games of chance or skill where users can wager cryptocurrency or tokens. These platforms typically leverage smart contracts for transparency and provable fairness in game outcomes.

oneOf.title: L3
oneOf.description: A blockchain built on a L2, often with a specific objective or function.

oneOf.title: Oracle
oneOf.description: Takes off chain data and makes it available on chain.

oneOf.title: Dust Collector
oneOf.description: Collects small parts of assets and may convert them.

oneOf.title: Trading Bot
oneOf.description: A bot, ususally in a chat app such as telegram, that enables its users to trade digital assets

oneOf.title: Hardware Wallet
oneOf.description: A private key manager that requires physical equipment in order for users to interact with their onchain assets.

oneOf.title: Shared Sequencer
oneOf.description: A specialized blockchain infrastructure component that orders and batches transactions for multiple chains, rollups, or applications.

oneOf.title: Messaging Protocol
oneOf.description: A decentralized communication infrastructure that enables secure, private, and often censorship-resistant exchange of messages between users or applications.

oneOf.title: Risk Assessment
oneOf.description: Platforms that provide ongoing risk analysis, scoring, and monitoring of DeFi protocols, smart contracts, and blockchain projects for investment and operational decision-making. Includes: Protocol risk scoring, DeFi risk analytics, continuous risk monitoring

oneOf.title: Bridge
oneOf.description: An application used to port assets from one blockchain to another.

oneOf.title: Bridge Aggregator
oneOf.description: An application that collects many different applications for the purpose of porting assets.

oneOf.title: Prediction Markets
oneOf.description: A place to make predictions on events that tend to be settled onchain.

oneOf.title: Decentralised Exchange
oneOf.description: A protocol that enables the trading of cryptocurrencies directly between users without the need for a central authority.

oneOf.title: DEX Aggregator
oneOf.description: A service that scans multiple decentralised exchanges, often to compare prices and liquidity for trading pairs.

oneOf.title: Centralised Exchange
oneOf.description: A platform where cryptocurrencies are traded through an authority or mediator that facilitates the transactions and often provides wallet services.

oneOf.title: On/Off Ramp
oneOf.description: Services that allow for the conversion between cryptocurrencies and fiat currencies, facilitating entry and exit points into the crypto market.

oneOf.title: Payments Infrastructure & Orchestration
oneOf.description: Middleware for developers that aggregates multiple payment providers, processors, and methods into unified APIs.

oneOf.title: Decentralised Identity
oneOf.description: Includes identity solutions that may follow DID standards or are products to do with issuing identity on blockchain networks.

oneOf.title: Social Platform
oneOf.description: Applications that facilitate online social interactions, community building, and content sharing, with optional blockchain-based features such as tokenized incentives, decentralized identity, or content ownership, but without primary focus on financial mechanisms or trading.

oneOf.title: Cross-chain Infrastructure
oneOf.description: Solutions that enable interoperability, communication, or asset transfers between different blockchain networks, facilitating cross-chain operations and ecosystem connectivity. This includes onchain asset wrapping, purely for the sake of making an onchain asset usable on another chain.

oneOf.title: Blockchain Gaming Infrastructure
oneOf.description: Tools, frameworks, and platforms that enable the development and integration of blockchain technology into games, facilitating features such as in-game economies, digital asset ownership, and decentralized gameplay mechanics.

oneOf.title: Decentralised Borrowing & Lending
oneOf.description: A peer-to-peer financial system on the blockchain that allows users to collateralize digital assets without the need for a central authority.

oneOf.title: RPC Provider
oneOf.description: A service that offers Remote Procedure Call (RPC) endpoints, allowing developers and applications to interact with blockchain networks without running a full node.

oneOf.title: Centralised Borrowing & Lending
oneOf.description: Platforms operated by mediating entities that facilitate the collateralization of digital assets, often with added features like interest accounts.

oneOf.title: Offchain Insurance
oneOf.description: Products and contracts that provide coverage for crypto-related risks and events, processed outside the blockchain.

oneOf.title: Onchain Insurance
oneOf.description: Products and contracts that provide coverage for crypto-related risks and events, executed automatically on the blockchain.

oneOf.title: Pricing Data API
oneOf.description: A service providing real-time and historical financial information for cryptocurrencies from various markets for integration into apps and services.

oneOf.title: OnChain Data API
oneOf.description: A service offering developers direct access to information stored on a blockchain, usually for the purpose of building applications on it.

oneOf.title: Transport
oneOf.description: A product that helps move things or people from A -> B

oneOf.title: Game
oneOf.description: Interactive digital entertainment designed on blockchain technology, often incorporating cryptocurrencies, NFTs, play to earn or tokenized assets for in-game transactions and ownership.

oneOf.title: Developer Tooling
oneOf.description: SDKs, frameworks, APIs, or services designed to facilitate the creation, testing, deployment, or integration of blockchain applications or transactions.

oneOf.title: DePin
oneOf.description: A catch all term for products that provide decentralised physical infrastructure (i.e., hardware rental).

oneOf.title: Staking Service
oneOf.description: Infrastructure, tools, and services that support staking operations, including validator management systems, delegation platforms, and staking pool infrastructure, and services for professional staking operations.

oneOf.title: NFT Marketplace
oneOf.description: An online platform where unique digital assets can be bought, sold or traded.

oneOf.title: NFT Issuance Platform
oneOf.description: A service that allows users to create and issue their own unique digital assets, typically involving digital art or collectibles.

oneOf.title: Block Explorer
oneOf.description: A tool that allows you to interact with onchain information or explore data.

oneOf.title: News & Media
oneOf.description: Creates, curates, or distributes Web3 content in various formats. It delivers research or information on market trends, tech news, and regulations while facilitating user engagement. It may use blockchain for content rights management and monetization. It includes subscription-based products.

oneOf.title: Market Maker
oneOf.description: A centralised service that provides liquidity to markets by continuously buying and selling assets, helping to ensure price stability and market efficiency in both centralized and decentralized environments. This does not refer to Automated Market Makers (AMMs) within DEXes.

oneOf.title: Mobile Phone
oneOf.description: A communication device that is often mobile. Often fits in ones hand and connected to the internet.

oneOf.title: Grants Platform
oneOf.description: A platform that enables companies or projects to create, issue and manage grants. Could also be a grant aggregator, may also be a jobs board but generally is focused on grants.

oneOf.title: Impact Initiative
oneOf.description: A project or platform designed to facilitate philanthropic endeavors and create positive social or environmental change. This includes charitable activities, donations, conservation efforts, and art initiatives.

oneOf.title: Events & Conferences
oneOf.description: A organized gathering or series of gatherings including conferences, summits, and workshops that facilitate knowledge sharing, networking, skill development, or innovation. These events may be in-person, virtual, or hybrid.

oneOf.title: Venture Services
oneOf.description: Specialized financial and support services, including venture capital, investment funds, accelerators, and incubators that provide funding, mentorship, resources, and networking opportunities to early-stage blockchain projects and startups.  Currently acts as a catch all for VC related activity.

oneOf.title: Decentralized File Storage
oneOf.description: A blockchain-based network or protocol that enables distributed storage and retrieval of digital files across multiple nodes.

oneOf.title: RWA Tokenisation Platform
oneOf.description: A platform that enables the conversion of rights to a physical asset into a digital token on a blockchain.

oneOf.title: Liquid Staking
oneOf.description: A form of securing a blockchain that involves locking up participants’ onchain assets, and the participants receive an asset in return that can be spent, traded or exchanged like any other fungible asset.

oneOf.title: Off-Chain Data APIs and Services
oneOf.description: APIs and platforms that collect, process, and serve data from traditional off-chain sources such as web content, social media, business intelligence, and internet resources.

oneOf.title: Derivatives
oneOf.description: Financial contracts on the blockchain whose value is based on the performance of an underlying digital asset, allowing for hedging, speculation, or access to new markets.

oneOf.title: Customer Engagement Platform
oneOf.description: Enables interaction with, management, and nurturing of customer relationships. Includes customer data management, communication tools, loyalty programs, analytics, and automation.

oneOf.title: Service Provider
oneOf.description: Offers specialized services to the the Web3 ecosystem which are not covered by the other product types. These include technical (development, infrastructure), business (marketing, PR, design), financial (accounting, tax), legal, consulting, and administrative services.

oneOf.title: Staking Data
oneOf.description: Data about staking across various networks, most often to do with networks that require nodes to do some form of staking.

oneOf.title: Onchain Compliance and Investigations
oneOf.description: Tools and services that monitor blockchain transactions for regulatory compliance, conduct investigations of illicit activities, generate compliance reports, and ensure adherence to AML/KYC requirements

oneOf.title: Data Terminal
oneOf.description: A comprehensive platform or interface providing real-time data and analysis tools, across various cryptocurrencies and digital stores of value.

oneOf.title: AI Agent
oneOf.description: A software program that uses artificial intelligence to autonomously execute specific tasks or make decisions within a blockchain ecosystem. For trading bots, please select the dedicated product type.

oneOf.title: AI Agent Platform
oneOf.description: A system that enables the creation, deployment, and management of multiple AI agents within a blockchain context. Provides infrastructure and tools for agent operation.

oneOf.title: Browser
oneOf.description: A web browser with integrated blockchain and cryptocurrency capabilities that enables users to interact with decentralized applications, manage digital assets, and access Web3 services.

oneOf.title: AI Agent Framework
oneOf.description: A self hosted way to build AI agents.

oneOf.title: Index Platform
oneOf.description: A suite of tools that provide baskets of assets for investors to get exposure to multiple assets at the same time

oneOf.title: Stablecoin Issuance
oneOf.description: The process of creating and managing digital currencies pegged to traditional assets like fiat money or gold to reduce volatility in the crypto market.

oneOf.title: Music
oneOf.description: Blockchain-based platforms that enable creators to tokenize, sell, and manage rights to their music, ensuring fair compensation and distribution.

oneOf.title: Node Software
oneOf.description: Software that enables computers to participate in blockchain networks by running validator nodes, consensus mechanisms like mining in PoW, PoS, or network maintenance functions.

oneOf.title: Pool Software
oneOf.description: Enables the aggregation of computational resources or liquidity from multiple participants, commonly used in DeFi protocols for staking, mining or liquidity provision.

oneOf.title: Multi-Sig Wallet
oneOf.description: A cryptocurrency wallet that requires multiple private keys to authorize a transaction, enhancing security by distributing control among multiple parties.

oneOf.title: Custody Technology Provider
oneOf.description: A solution for secure storage and management of digital assets. Typically enables account abstraction (ERC-4337) and self-custody via white-label custody service or Wallets-as-a-service (WaaS). Not to be confused with embedded wallets.

oneOf.title: Custodian
oneOf.description: An entity responsible for holding and safeguarding a client's securities or assets to prevent theft or loss.

oneOf.title: DAO Management Platform
oneOf.description: Provides tools for the creation, administration and governance of entities that have a flattened hierarchy for decision-making and operating.

oneOf.title: Internet of Things (IoT)
oneOf.description: Facilitates secure, decentralized communication and transactions between connected devices with the integration of blockchain technology.

oneOf.title: Trading Terminal
oneOf.description: A comprehensive platform or interface providing real-time data, analysis tools, and trading capabilities across various cryptocurrencies and digital stores of value.

oneOf.title: Wallet
oneOf.description: A software application or hardware device that stores private keys and allows users to send, receive, and manage their cryptocurrency assets.

oneOf.title: Card
oneOf.description: A physical or virtual credit or debit card that enables users to spend their crypto without convering it to fiat first.

oneOf.title: Hackathon
oneOf.description: An online or in-person event where developers, designers and innovators collaborate to build and prototype tech solutions. It is typically time-limited, often culminating in presentations, demos and prizes.

oneOf.title: Online Retail Platform
oneOf.description: Ecommerce platforms that sell physical goods, services, or digital products directly to consumers using cryptocurrency as a payment method. Excludes specialized gift card marketplaces and payment infrastructure providers

oneOf.title: Node Hosting
oneOf.description: Managed services that operate blockchain validator infrastructure on behalf of customers, including node deployment and maintenance.

oneOf.title: Travel Booking Site
oneOf.description: A website that allows users to use Web3/crypto to book travel, be that hotels or travel. Often are aggregators of supply.

oneOf.title: Privacy Pool
oneOf.description: A protocol that allows users to deposit assets into a shared pool and withdraw them to different addresses, breaking the on-chain link between source and destination to enhance transaction privacy while maintaining verifiability. Implements technologies such as zero-knowledge proofs or other cryptographic methods to provide transaction confidentiality.

oneOf.title: OTC
oneOf.description: Provides Over The Counter services

oneOf.title: Ticketing
oneOf.description: Platforms that support with ticketing, they may have Web3 options enabled or issue our tickets using NFTs

oneOf.title: Smart Contract Audits
oneOf.description: Professional services that review smart contracts and blockchain protocols to identify vulnerabilities, bugs, and security issues through manual analysis, automated tools, or both. Includes: Blockchain Auditing Companies, professional audit firms, security review services

oneOf.title: Node Hardware
oneOf.description: Physical hardware devices that users purchase, deploy, and operate to participate directly in blockchain networks or decentralized infrastructure. Includes mining hardware, DePin devices, IoT gateways, and specialized network equipment that provides computational power, coverage, or services while earning rewards for operators.

oneOf.title: Blockchain Development Security Tools
oneOf.description: Software tools, platforms, and frameworks that help developers build secure smart contracts and blockchain applications, including vulnerability testing, code analysis, fuzzing, security testing frameworks, and development-time security monitoring.

oneOf.title: Education and Training
oneOf.description: Platforms, competitions, educational programs, courses, certifications, and training resources that facilitate knowledge and skills development across blockchain, Web3, and cryptocurrency domains through structured learning experiences.

oneOf.title: Embedded Wallet
oneOf.description: A developer toolkit that enables applications to create and manage wallets directly within their platform, allowing users to interact with blockchain features without requiring external wallet connections.

oneOf.title: Validator
oneOf.description: A network participant that validates transactions and produces blocks in proof-of-stake blockchain networks, accepting stake delegations and earning rewards for maintaining network security and consensus.

oneOf.title: Bug Bounty Competitions
oneOf.description: Platforms that offer monetary rewards for discovering and responsibly disclosing vulnerabilities in live blockchain protocols, smart contracts, or Web3 applications through crowdsourced security testing with structured reward mechanisms.

oneOf.title: B2B Invoicing & Billing
oneOf.description: Formal invoice management systems with line items, payment terms, approval workflows, and accounting integration for business transactions.

oneOf.title: Payroll
oneOf.description: Tools that support orginisations to do payroll with crypto as the primary method of paying employees or contractors.

oneOf.title: Merchant Payment Gateway
oneOf.description: Direct integration solutions for businesses to accept cryptocurrency payments from customers at point-of-sale or online checkout. It can also be referred to as a "crypto payment processor."

oneOf.title: Bill Pay tools
oneOf.description: Tools that enable users to pay their bills using crypto often by accepting crypto payments and then paying out in fiat to a recipient bank account.

oneOf.title: Tax tooling & Accounting
oneOf.description: Tools that provide internal financial management, record-keeping, and tax preparation for crypto and digital assets. This includes accounting workflows, transaction tracking for financial purposes, treasury management, audit trails, financial reporting, and operational financial controls for businesses and individuals.

oneOf.title: Token distribution tool
oneOf.description: Tools to help with the mass distribution of crypto assets often used to distribute assets around unlocks or other important events.

oneOf.title: Trade finance
oneOf.description: Enterprise and business focused services that support international trade where guarantees of payments are important to reduce counter party risk. It may provide a combination or all services around letters of credit and documentary collection.

oneOf.title: Payment network
oneOf.description: Services that may be traditional in nature, maybe supporting stablecoin rails, that facilitates the transfer of funds between two or more parties, such as a customer and a merchant, or between financial institutions

oneOf.title: Card issuance
oneOf.description: Services that help companies issue cards and manage relationships with payment networks

oneOf.title: Gift Cards & Digital Vouchers
oneOf.description: Specialized platforms focused primarily on the sale and distribution of gift cards, digital vouchers, and related digital goods (mobile top-ups, eSIMs, gaming credits) purchasable with cryptocurrency. Includes both direct-to-consumer marketplaces and B2B distribution services.

oneOf.title: Payment Links & Request Tools
oneOf.description: Simple, instant payment requests via QR codes or links for ad-hoc transactions without formal invoicing features.

oneOf.title: Subscription & Streaming Payments
oneOf.description: Platforms that enable recurring payment models through subscription billing with fixed intervals or streaming payments with continuous value flows, featuring automated payment processing, failed payment recovery, and payment analytics.

oneOf.title: Peer to Peer & Remittance
oneOf.description: Applications and tools designed for peer-to-peer money transfers and cross-border remittances. These platforms focus on facilitating direct payments between individuals rather than serving as general-purpose digital wallets with broader functionality.

oneOf.title: Social Trading
oneOf.description: Platforms that integrate social features with trading functionality, allowing users to share, follow, copy, or collaborate on trading strategies and investment decisions.

oneOf.title: Social Infrastructure
oneOf.description: Protocol-layer infrastructure and tools that enable social networking functionality, identity management, or community-building capabilities for other applications and platforms.

oneOf.title: Financial Services Platform
oneOf.description: Banking-as-a-Service platforms that provide consumers and businesses with traditional banking capabilities (personal/corporate accounts, payment cards, treasury services) enhanced with blockchain technology for digital asset management and cross-chain operations.

oneOf.title: Social Payments
oneOf.description: Applications that enable cryptocurrency transactions through social media platforms and messaging services using social identifiers (handles, usernames, mentions) instead of traditional wallet addresses. These tools integrate with existing social platforms through browser extensions, bots, or native integrations to facilitate peer-to-peer transfers within social contexts.

productStatuses.description: The current development or access stage of the product (e.g. Beta, Live, Deprecated).

oneOf.description: not set

oneOf.title: In Development
oneOf.description: The product has been announced but is not yet accessible to users, and no further information has been provided.

oneOf.title: Early access
oneOf.description: It is possible to apply for product access, but access is not guaranteed for all users.

oneOf.title: Discontinued
oneOf.description: The product has been taken offline and is no longer accessable to any user. It could be superseeded by other products.

oneOf.title: Open Beta
oneOf.description: The product is currently being tested and often has a disclaimer.

oneOf.title: Live
oneOf.description: The product is fully deployed, accessible, and usable by anyone.

oneOf.title: Support Ended
oneOf.description: The development of this product has come to an end but as it is publicly accessable, either onchain or a framework, the product may still be accessible. If the product is an event that has concluded, choose this option.

isMainProducts.description: A boolean value indicating whether the product is the Profile's primary or flagship offering.

entityTypes.description: The legal structure or registration category of the Entity (e.g. LLC, Foundation, Corporation).

oneOf.description: not set

oneOf.title: Foundation
oneOf.description: An entity that conducts activities without the purpose of generating profit, and is set up as a foundation in its local jurisdiction.

oneOf.title: Corporation
oneOf.description: A for-profit company in its local jurisdiction that may function as an umbrella entity for other companies. Examples include: LLC, BV, ЗАО, S.R.L. and other commonly known forms of business entity.

oneOf.title: Startup
oneOf.description: A new, for-profit company in its local jurisdiction that is often building a technology-related product, entering an emerging market, seeking non-traditional funding, or a combination of such activities.

oneOf.title: Goverment Agency
oneOf.description: A representative or organization that acts on behalf of a nation state’s interests.

oneOf.title: Listed Company
oneOf.description: A for-profit entity that has successfully issued equity that can be traded on at least one stock exchange.

assetTypes.description: The primary category or function of the Asset (e.g. Currency, Utility, Security) and what is does.

oneOf.description: not set

oneOf.title: Currency
oneOf.description: General cryptocurrency used for payment or investment purposes

oneOf.title: Stablecoin
oneOf.description: A token often pegged to a fiat currency or traditional commodity.

oneOf.title: NFT
oneOf.description: Unique token usually representing a piece of art, often part of a collection.

oneOf.title: Digital Reward Assets
oneOf.description: Virtual currencies or points issued by platforms, programs, or games that can be exchanged for cryptocurrencies, NFTs, fiat money, or other real-world assets. These assets represent value within a specific ecosystem but may adopt broader utility.

oneOf.title: Liquid Staking Tokens (LSTs)
oneOf.description: Tokens that represent staked assets while maintaining liquidity, allowing holders to earn staking rewards and simultaneously use the tokens in DeFi applications.

oneOf.title: Restaked Tokens
oneOf.description: Tokens created when staked assets (often LSTs) are redeployed to secure additional protocols, enabling the same asset to generate multiple revenue streams.

oneOf.title: Wrapped Tokens
oneOf.description: One-to-one representations of assets from other blockchains, enabling cross-chain functionality while maintaining direct backing by the original asset.

oneOf.title: Synthetic Assets
oneOf.description: Smart contract-based tokens that track and mirror the price of other assets (crypto or traditional) without requiring direct ownership of the underlying asset.

oneOf.title: Bridged Tokens
oneOf.description: Cross-chain token representations created when assets are locked on their original chain and reissued on a target chain through bridging protocols.

oneOf.title: Memecoin
oneOf.description: A token with minimal utility derived from online cultural phenomena and its originating ecosystem/community.

oneOf.title: Utility
oneOf.description: A token required to take action or redeem services within a specific system.

oneOf.title: Governance
oneOf.description: A token required for decision-making within a protocol or entity.

oneOf.title: Security
oneOf.description: A token clearly marked to represent a fungible financial instrument.

oneOf.title: Vault Tokens
oneOf.description: Tokens representing proportional ownership in yield-bearing vaults or funds, where the token value increases based on returns generated bya underlying assets. Users can deposit base assets to mint vault tokens and redeem them for the base asset plus accrued yield.

assetStatuses.description: The current development or access stage of the asset. Refer to the standardized list of asset status options.

oneOf.title: In Development
oneOf.description: The asset has been announced but is not yet launched or fully implemented. It's still in the creation or testing phase.

oneOf.title: Active
oneOf.description: The asset is currently in use, tradable, and fully functional within its intended ecosystem. Regular updates and transactions are occurring.

oneOf.title: Inactive
oneOf.description: The asset is not currently active in the ecosystem, either due to ceased development (i.e., migration to a new address due to a rebrand) or lack of usage (no recent updates or significant trading activity).

socialStatuses.description: The current operational state of the social. Refer to the standardized list of status options.

oneOf.title: Active
oneOf.description: The social account has consistent content publication, audience interaction, and platform presence within the last 90 days (for YouTube & Github, 180 days).

oneOf.title: Inactive
oneOf.description: Status indicating that a social media account has stopped posting content regularly and shows little to no engagement with its audience.

tagTypes.description: A reference to a connected table that contains a type. A type of tag provides some context as to what a tag is and also contains a description.

oneOf.description: not set

oneOf.title: Event
oneOf.description: A time-bound gathering, conference, or organized program.

oneOf.title: Community
oneOf.description: A defined group of users, developers, or stakeholders organized around a shared interest or purpose.

oneOf.title: Tech
oneOf.description: A collection of profiles unified by their use of a specific technology, protocol, or technical standard

oneOf.title: Geography
oneOf.description: A grouping based on physical location, jurisdiction, or regional market focus (i.e., a country or city).

oneOf.title: Paradigm
oneOf.description: A distinct approach, methodology, or philosophical framework and its applications.

deploymentTypes.description: Categorizes the type of deployment based on the smart contract’s main purpose. For example, if the contract is primarily used to mint an asset, it will be tagged as ‘mint’.

oneOf.title: not set
oneOf.description: Not set

oneOf.title: Mint
oneOf.description: A deployment that creates and manages assets on-chain

oneOf.title: Pool
oneOf.description: A deployment that makes up a pool, usually in a DEX

oneOf.title: General
oneOf.description: A general smart contract deployment

assetStandards.description: The technical standard or protocol specification that the smart contract implements. If the standard cannot be identified, leave this field blank.

oneOf.description: (not set)

oneOf.title: ERC-20
oneOf.description: A standard for fungible tokens on the Ethereum blockchain, defining a common set of rules for token implementation to ensure compatibility across the ecosystem.

oneOf.title: ERC-721
oneOf.description: A standard for non-fungible tokens on the Ethereum blockchain, allowing for the creation of unique digital assets with distinct properties and ownership rights.

oneOf.title: ERC-1155
oneOf.description: A multi-token standard on Ethereum that allows for the creation of both fungible and non-fungible tokens within a single smart contract.

oneOf.title: TRC-20
oneOf.description: The TRON blockchain's equivalent of ERC-20, used for creating fungible tokens on the TRON network.

oneOf.title: ASA
oneOf.description: Algorand Standard Asset - Algorand's native token standard that supports both fungible and non-fungible tokens.

oneOf.title: FA2
oneOf.description: Financial Application 2 - Tezos blockchain's unified token contract interface for all token types.

oneOf.title: ERC-777
oneOf.description: An improved version of the ERC-20 standard on Ethereum, offering additional features like operator management and hooks.

oneOf.title: BEP-2
oneOf.description: The original token standard for the Binance Chain (not to be confused with Binance Smart Chain).

oneOf.title: Cosmos SDK
oneOf.description: While not a token standard per se, it's a framework used by many Cosmos-based blockchains to create their native tokens.

oneOf.title: ERC-4626
oneOf.description: A standard for tokenized vaults on Ethereum, commonly used in DeFi applications.

oneOf.title: PSP22
oneOf.description: The primary fungible token standard on the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems.

oneOf.title: spl-token-2022
oneOf.description: Solana Token 2022 - An upgraded version of the original SPL token standard. The Solana Token 2022 program introduces several new features and improvements over the original SPL token standard, aiming to provide more flexibility and functionality for token.

oneOf.title: BEP-20
oneOf.description: BEP20 tokens are fungible tokens, based on the popular ERC-20 standard from Ethereum, designed for use on the Binance Smart Chain.

oneOf.title: SPL
oneOf.description: The Solana Program Library token standard, used for creating both fungible and non-fungible tokens on the Solana blockchain, offering high speed and low transaction costs.

urlTypes.description: Categorizes the purpose and content of a URL based on its table group in the TGS. The URL type must align with both the content it links to and the context of its parameter group (Profile/Product/Asset/Entity/Social).

oneOf.description: (not set)

oneOf.title: Main
oneOf.description: The main URL that is used by the profiles table

oneOf.title: Blog
oneOf.description: Links to blogs

oneOf.title: Documentation
oneOf.description: Link to most informative documentation link. Normally the homepage of the docs area or subdomain of a website (Note documentation is used in profile, assets, products, and deployments)

oneOf.title: Whitepaper
oneOf.description: Links to whitepapers, often in PDF format

oneOf.title: Product
oneOf.description: The main URL of a product and the best place to access the product.

oneOf.title: Entity
oneOf.description: The official URL of the entity

oneOf.title: Social
oneOf.description: A catch-all for social media links

oneOf.title: Extra source
oneOf.description: These are URLs for internal use that point to important links that provide content.

oneOf.title: Apple App Store
oneOf.description: Product page in Apple App Store.

oneOf.title: Chrome Web Store
oneOf.description: Product page in Chrome Web Store.

oneOf.title: Forum
oneOf.description: A place that the profile normally moderates where discussions can take place.

oneOf.title: Governance
oneOf.description: A link to the place where governance decisions are made

oneOf.title: Google Play Store
oneOf.description: Links to the google play store

oneOf.title: Media Kit
oneOf.description: If you find a link to a media kit, we may as well track it.

oneOf.title: Support Coverage
oneOf.description: Pages documenting supported countries, assets, networks, protocols, or service coverage areas

oneOf.title: Terms of Service
oneOf.description: A link to their terms of service

oneOf.title: Privacy policy
oneOf.description: A link to their terms of service

oneOf.title: MICA Whitepaper
oneOf.description: Links to official MICA Whitepapers

oneOf.title: Deployment
oneOf.description: Links to deployments

oneOf.title: Asset Info
oneOf.description: The main URL to find asset info (not tokenomics or technical info)

assetSupportTypes.description: A classification of the functional relationship between a product and an asset, indicating how the asset is utilized within the product's operations.

oneOf.description: Not set

oneOf.title: Native to
oneOf.description: A core asset of the protocol behind this product (e.g., BTC for the Bitcoin Network)

oneOf.title: Supported by
oneOf.description: Protocol-level integration (i.e., explicit listing or deployment, exchange deposits, oracle price feeds, accepted in pools, as collateral, or other DeFi purposes) or 3rd party explicit support (i.e., via APIs)

oneOf.title: Governance
oneOf.description: The main governance asset for this product (e.g., UNI for Uniswap)

oneOf.title: Managed by
oneOf.description: The asset is managed by this product, also includes asset issuance (eg stablecoin providers)

oneOf.title: Launched via
oneOf.description: This asset was issued via a certain product

oneOf.title: Utility
oneOf.description: This asset is the main asset for the product and is used as the primary method of payment or necessary for interaction with the product

oneOf.title: Distributed via
oneOf.description: This assets distribution is managed or supported by a third party product.

oneOf.title: Payment Accepted by
oneOf.description: Can receive as payment, including automatic conversions to other assets and integrated 3rd party payment gateways

rootRelationshipTypes.description: What is the type of relationship, links to the type table.

oneOf.title: Acquired by
oneOf.description: This profile was acquired by the parent.

oneOf.title: Associated with
oneOf.description: This profile is connected to another profile via a shared group, DAO or foundation for example.

oneOf.title: Managed by
oneOf.description: This profile is controlled and built by the parent for example core development team. This is the same as a parent brand.

oneOf.title: Product of
oneOf.description: This profile is a sub product, that is listed on a separate domain, to the parent profile.

mediaTypes.description: Link to the image type classification (e.g., logo, icon, header, screenshot).
